p: Total flavonoids in A. amatymbica were quantified using the method of Arjamand et al. [ 23]. Half a millilitre (0.5 mL) of 2% AlCl 3 in ethanol was added to 0.5 mL (1 mg/mL) of the sample solution and incubated for 1 hour at room temperature, after which the absorbance was measured at 420 nm. The extracted sample was evaluated at a final concentration of 0.1 mg/mL, and the flavonoid content was calculated as quercetin (mg/g) equivalents using the following equation based on the calibration curve: Y = 0.025 x + 0.1335 ( R 2 = 0.9812), and expressed as mg of quercetin equivalent (QE/g).
